3dc85dfd-dec0-4e02-9475-24a39a21a43e.description: Earners of the RHIT® credential are able to ensure the quality of medical records by verifying their completeness, accuracy, and proper entry into computer systems. They are competent in the use of computer applications to assemble and analyze patient data for the purpose of improving patient care or controlling costs. Specialized roles include: coding diagnoses/procedures in patient records and working as cancer registrars compiling and maintaining data on cancer patients.
3dc85dfd-dec0-4e02-9475-24a39a21a43e.name: Registered Health Information Technician (RHIT®)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Registered Health Information Technician (RHIT®) exam
Complete one of the following to be eligible for the exam:

Successfully complete the academic requirements, at an associate's degree level, of an HIM program accredited by the Commission on Accreditation for Health Informatics and Information Management Education (CAHIIM)
Graduate from an HIM program approved by a foreign association with which AHIMA has a reciprocity agreement

eec9dd12-fea5-4d2a-baf9-7cf0e797896e.description: Earners of the CCS® credential have advanced skills in classifying medical data from patient records, generally in a hospital setting. These coding practitioners possess expertise in the ICD-10-CM, CPT and HCPCS Level II coding systems. They are knowledgeable about medical terminology, disease processes, and pharmacology. They are able to review patients' records and assign numeric codes for each diagnosis and procedure. They can apply policies for access and disclosure of health information.
eec9dd12-fea5-4d2a-baf9-7cf0e797896e.name: Certified Coding Specialist (CCS®)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Certified Coding Specialist (CCS®) Exam
Must complete one of the following to be eligible for the exam:
Earn one of the following credentials from AHIMA: RHIA®, RHIT®, or CCS-P®

Complete all of the following courses: anatomy & physiology, pathophysiology, pharmacology, medical terminology, reimbursement methodology, intermediate/advanced ICD diagnostic/procedural and CPT coding
Minimum of two years of related coding experience directly applying codes
Hold the CCA® credential plus one year of coding experience directly applying codes
Other Coding credential from other certifying organization plus one year coding experience directly applying codes

cb4bf2f4-8dd3-4aa0-a73c-281cbff29930.description: Earners of the RHIA® credential are experts in managing patient health information and medical records, administering computer information systems, collecting and analyzing patient data, and using classification systems and medical terminologies. They possess comprehensive knowledge of medical, administrative, ethical and legal requirements and standards related to healthcare delivery and the privacy of protected patient information.
cb4bf2f4-8dd3-4aa0-a73c-281cbff29930.name: Registered Health Information Administrator (RHIA®)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Registered Health Information Administrator (RHIA®) exam
Complete one of the following to be eligible for the exam:

Successfully complete the academic requirements, at the baccalaureate level, of an HIM program accredited by the Commission on Accreditation for Health Informatics and Information Management Education (CAHIIM)
Successfully complete the academic requirements, at the master’s level, of an HIM program accredited by CAHIIM and following a specific set of criteria
Graduate from an HIM program approved by a foreign association with which AHIMA has a reciprocity agreement

a25f1871-fe37-4fbb-8552-7770d4c38d37.description: Earners of the CCA® credential have basic coding competency in any setting, including both hospitals and physician practices. They have demonstrated a level of commitment, competency, and professional capability that employers are looking for while demonstrating a commitment to the coding profession.
a25f1871-fe37-4fbb-8552-7770d4c38d37.name: Certified Coding Associate (CCA®)

badge_template_activities.title: Earn high school diploma or equivalent
Complete AHIMA-approved coding program (PCAP Program) or equivalent
Score a passing grade on the Certified Coding Associate (CCA) Exam

8123c9ed-f1e4-444b-9213-f10cf5ee1276.description: Earners of the (CCS-P®) credential specialize in physician-based settings such as physician offices, group practices, multi-specialty clinics, or specialty centers. They are competent in reviewing patient records and assigning numeric codes for each diagnosis and procedure. They possess in-depth knowledge of the CPT coding system and familiarity with the ICD-10-CM and HCPCS Level II coding systems. They are experts in health information documentation, data integrity, and quality
8123c9ed-f1e4-444b-9213-f10cf5ee1276.name: Certified Coding Specialist- Physician-based (CCS-P®)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Certified Coding Specialist- Physician-based(CCS-P®) exam
Must complete one of the following to be eligible for the exam:
Earn one of the following credentials: RHIA®, RHIT®, or CCS®

Complete all of the following courses: anatomy & physiology, pathophysiology, pharmacology, medical terminology, reimbursement methodology, intermediate/advanced ICD diagnostic/procedural and CPT coding
Minimum of two years of related coding experience directly applying codes
CCA® plus one year of coding experience directly applying codes
Other Coding credential from other certifying organization plus one year coding experience directly applying codes

403865f7-8d2e-4bba-b07a-9b834066ae70.description: Designation as an AHIMA-Approved ICD-10-CM/PCS Trainer represents individuals already experienced in ICD-9 who are prepared to train others in ICD-10-CM and ICD-10-PCS and proficiency in ICD-10-CM/PCS subject matter.
403865f7-8d2e-4bba-b07a-9b834066ae70.name: AHIMA-Approved ICD-10-CM/PCS Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: Requires attendance at AHIMA ICD-10-CM/PCS Trainer Academy and passing an assessment. Trainers must renew annually.

99fff212-654f-4b00-88c8-1f4eee02bd8b.description: Earners of the CDIP® are knowledgeable and competent in providing guidance relative to clinical documentation in patient health records: exhibit leadership skills in promoting CDI efforts, team management and CDI project management; providing high level of skills in working with providers to clarify POA, HAC and PSI; skilled in the development of policies and procedures related to query practices and overall CDI systems; knowledgeable in assigning ICD-10-CM/PCS, DRG or HCPCS codes.
99fff212-654f-4b00-88c8-1f4eee02bd8b.name: Certified Documentation Improvement Practitioner (CDIP®)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Certified Documentation Improvement Practitioner (CDIP®) exam
Must complete one of the following to be eligible for the exam:
Earn one of the following credentials and complete two years experience in clinical documentation improvement: RHIA®, RHIT®, CCS®, CCS-P®, RN, MD or DO

Complete Associate’s degree or higher and three years of experience in clinical documentation improvement (candidates must also have completed coursework in Medical Terminology and Anatomy and Physiology)

5292f333-b83b-4d1c-bd98-20b6d9ca6a60.description: Earners of the CHPS® are competent in designing, implementing, and administering comprehensive privacy and security protection programs in all types of healthcare organization. Specializing in the privacy and security dimensions of HIM shows a commitment to advancing privacy and security management practices and lifelong learning and professional development
5292f333-b83b-4d1c-bd98-20b6d9ca6a60.name: Certified in Healthcare Privacy and Security (CHPS®)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Certified in Healthcare Privacy and Security (CHPS®) exam
Complete one of the following to be eligible for the exam:
Earn an Associate’s degree and six (6) years experience in healthcare privacy or security management
Obtain the healthcare information management credential (RHIT®) and a minimum of four (4) years of experience in healthcare privacy or security management
Earn a Baccalaureate degree and a minimum of four years experience in healthcare privacy or security management
Healthcare information management credential (RHIA®) and minimum of two years of experience in healthcare privacy or security management
Master's or related degree (JD, MD, or PhD) and two years of experience in healthcare privacy or security management

f1f81abe-71e5-4c35-b7c9-ff6260532dab.description: Earners of the CHDA® credential have the knowledge to acquire, manage, analyze, interpret, and transform data into accurate, consistent, and timely information, while balancing the "big picture" strategic vision with day-to-day details. CHDA-credentialed professionals exhibit broad organizational knowledge and the ability to communicate with individuals and groups at multiple levels, both internal and external. This is a prestigious certification.
f1f81abe-71e5-4c35-b7c9-ff6260532dab.name: Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA®)

badge_template_activities.title: Score a passing grade on the Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA®) exam
Complete one of the following to be eligible for the exam:
Obtain the healthcare information management credential (RHIT®) and a minimum of three years of healthcare data experience
Baccalaureate degree and a minimum of three years of healthcare data experience
Healthcare information management credential (RHIA®)
Master’s in Heath Information Management (HIM) or Health Informatics from an accredited school
Master's or higher degree and one year of healthcare data experience

26b40ecd-06d4-4f52-806e-2fd33c7a39e1.description: Designation as an AHIMA-Approved ICD-10-CM Trainer represents individuals who are prepared to train others in ICD-10-CM and proficiency in ICD-10-CM subject matter.
26b40ecd-06d4-4f52-806e-2fd33c7a39e1.name: AHIMA-Approved ICD-10-CM Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: Requires attendance at AHIMA ICD-10-CM Trainer Academy and passing an assessment. Trainers must renew annually.

dd94b1f9-efd7-40c3-8879-f2ba801d9ba0.description: Health Information Management professionals who earn the title of an "AHIMA-Approved Revenue Cycle Trainer" have displayed an expert level of knowledge in the revenue cycle. These trainers are individuals who are knowledgeable in the practices and processes of the revenue cycle and are prepared to train others. They apply adult learning principals in education and support professionals involved in the revenue cycle.
dd94b1f9-efd7-40c3-8879-f2ba801d9ba0.name: AHIMA-Approved Revenue Cycle Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: AHIMA Membership
RHIA, RHIT, CCS, CCS-P or CDIP
Successfully complete the AHIMA-Approved Revenue Cycle Trainer Workshop and pass the assessment

6f3cbc03-c26e-48f6-a905-94feeb971acb.description: The AHIMA Fellowship program is earned recognition for AHIMA members who made significant and sustained contributions to the profession. This program recognizes those who have significantly contributed to the advancement of the HIM discipline and profession through meritorious service, excellence in professional practice and in HIM education. Earners may use the designation Fellow of the American Health Information Management Association and names will be maintained in the Registry of Fellows.
6f3cbc03-c26e-48f6-a905-94feeb971acb.name: AHIMA Fellows

badge_template_activities.title: Fellows demonstrate evidence of sustained and substantial professional achievement that demonstrates professional growth and use of innovative and creative solutions

Fellows have: a minimum of 10 years full-time professional experience in HIM or a related field; a minimum of 10 years continuous AHIMA membership (not including years as a student member); a minimum of master's degree

85f2b36f-c537-4713-9009-2329237acb30.description: Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI) professionals who earn the title of an "AHIMA-Approved CDI Trainer" have displayed an expert level of knowledge in CDI. These trainers are individuals who are proficient in CDI practices and processes and are prepared to train others. They have the knowledge of adult learning principals to support ongoing professional development for CDI professionals.
85f2b36f-c537-4713-9009-2329237acb30.name: AHIMA-Approved CDI Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: Member of AHIMA
Certified Documentation Improvement Practitioner (CDIP)
Successfully complete the AHIMA-Approved CDI Trainer Workshop

ec19ea9e-d692-4ca7-b6db-2bc722b1905f.description: Earners of this badge have created a course syllabus that is compliant with the Commission on Accreditation for Health Informatics and Information Management Education (CAHIIM) requirements and includes appropriate standards, goals, objectives and assessment. Earners with this skill set are prepared to begin teaching in an HIM program.
ec19ea9e-d692-4ca7-b6db-2bc722b1905f.name: HIM Faculty 1.0

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a ten-week asynchronous course

4e5ddd32-2e62-4838-884a-34e4080b4ea8.description: Earners of this badge have created an effective unit plan including Bloom’s Taxonomy, assessments and rubrics for one CAHIIM curriculum competency. Earners with this skill set are able to create and assess course objectives at the appropriate Bloom’s Taxonomy level.
4e5ddd32-2e62-4838-884a-34e4080b4ea8.name: HIM Faculty 2.0

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a ten-week asynchronous course

496a22e8-21a3-4744-a2b8-6eab4a033f18.description: Mentors who earn this badge completed a faculty mentoring course which corresponded with their individual mentees course. Course content is related to CAHIIM requirements and includes appropriate standards, goals, objectives and assessment according to curriculum competencies. The mentor provided adequate and timely feedback via group discussions, personalized feedback via assignment assessment and supported synthesis of mentee knowledge.
496a22e8-21a3-4744-a2b8-6eab4a033f18.name: HIM Faculty Mentor 1.0

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of three years' HIM teaching experience with a CAHIM credited program
Obtain the AHIMA RHIT or RHIA credential

fd2331b9-1250-4d77-a40e-12265e221dfa.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Mentor Award honors individuals or groups with long records of encouraging individuals to realize their full potential, or have helped them find ways to achieve their best.  AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
fd2331b9-1250-4d77-a40e-12265e221dfa.name: Triumph Award: Mentor

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient provides ongoing, long-term career guidance to one or more HIM professionals
Recipient motivates talented individuals to enter the HIM field and fosters enthusiasm for the profession
Recipient encourages new professionals to become involved in AHIMA activities at the state and local level and supports their efforts
Recipient may have provided clinical sites and supervision to help students achieve professional competencies, or may have supported the training of new professionals

23338f2b-808a-4104-aadb-b153b040d5e8.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Legacy Award, renamed in 2011 to the Literary Legacy Award, builds on the enduring  tradition of the Edna K. Huffman Literary Award.  It honors significant contributions to the HIM fields  knowledge base through a recent insightful publication. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
23338f2b-808a-4104-aadb-b153b040d5e8.name: Triumph Award: Legacy

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients authored and published books, chapters, articles, and/or guides that presented new theoretical concepts or provided further development of concepts previously advanced by others
Recipients provided tools to educate health information professionals or the general public and provided high visibility to the HIM profession and the healthcare community

d5cf2b4c-44dd-41c3-8596-932a7dd3c2b3.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Educator Award honors those who demonstrate excellence in preparing the next generation of professionals for their HIM careers. Recipients are individuals, or a department of educators, who are instructors that teach in a formal degree-granting HIM or HIT program and who are involved in AHIMA activities at the state or national level. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
d5cf2b4c-44dd-41c3-8596-932a7dd3c2b3.name: Triumph Award: Educator

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient contributed as a leader in HIM education, and developed and implemented creative teaching tools and methods
Recipient established and maintained high standards of excellence and high expectations of students
Recipient demonstrated awareness of the instructor’s impact as a role model, and committed oneself to student mentoring in the classroom and beyond
Recipient contributed to the research base and/or community of student learners, and/or dedication to the classroom/laboratory-based teaching of the field

7a88ec2e-b129-4a36-9773-86bb2f499923.description: Clinical Documentation Integrity (CDI) professionals who earn the title of an "AHIMA International CDI Specialist" have experience working in CDI in either the inpatient or outpatient setting. These professionals are competent in skills such as writing compliant queries, calculating and reporting CDI metrics and statistics, effectively communicating with physicians to clarify documentation, and knowledgeable in assigning region-specific diagnosis and procedure codes and DRGs.
7a88ec2e-b129-4a36-9773-86bb2f499923.name: AHIMA International CDI Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of AHIMA CDI Academy, Fundamentals of CDI Excellence, & CDI Insights courses
Successfully pass the AHIMA International CDI Specialist exam

2b66972c-e925-410e-a038-2c7bc70d444e.description: Mentors who earn this badge completed a faculty mentoring course which corresponded with their individual mentees course. Course content is related to Bloom’s Taxonomy, assessments and rubrics. The mentor provided adequate and timely feedback via group discussions, personalized feedback via assignment assessment and supported synthesis of mentee knowledge.
2b66972c-e925-410e-a038-2c7bc70d444e.name: HIM Faculty Mentor 2.0

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a minimum of three years' HIM teaching experience wit ha CAHIM accredited program
Obtain the AHIMA RHIT or RHIA credential

889b65de-7a2c-4a89-bfd9-eb3ca162439c.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Leadership Award honors individuals or groups who have provided outstanding service as leaders: presenting AHIMA and the profession positively through honesty, integrity and transparency; leading by example as team players and collaborators; serving as authorities in the HIM profession. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
889b65de-7a2c-4a89-bfd9-eb3ca162439c.name: Triumph Award: Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have proven leadership abilities, and have distinguished themselves in the profession as a recognized leader through vision, strategy, creativity, innovation, and positive transformation of both the workplace and the professional field

Recipient provided examples of leadership abilities and long-term benefits in the work and volunteer environments, including skills in business management, critical thinking, team leadership, and the development of others
Recipient displayed personal values, ethics, equity, and integrity, as well as open-mindedness and flexibility in decision making
Recipient led others and established trust through consensus building, creating a climate of empowerment, and advancing inclusion while transforming the workplace by motivating and coaching others

ab94b8a1-5958-40d0-8cb5-967a1204bf2e.description: Individuals have displayed knowledge, skills, and abilities in the application of codes and conventions related to ICD-10-AM and CCHI-BS.
ab94b8a1-5958-40d0-8cb5-967a1204bf2e.name: AHIMA Certificate in Outpatient Coding

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of outpatient coder certificate program and exam.
Demonstrate comprehensive knowledge in coding related subject areas.

2ccb9d8f-6d03-4842-8d1f-ee06b9c26379.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Student Award, previously named the “New Frontier Award,” recognizes students who are leaders both inside and outside the classroom at CAHIIM-accredited health information programs, or AHIMA-approved coding programs, nationwide. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
2ccb9d8f-6d03-4842-8d1f-ee06b9c26379.name: Triumph Award: Student

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient maintained a grade point equivalent of 3.5 out of 4.0, or higher
Recipient demonstrates leadership and commitment to the future of the HIM profession through participation in HIM-related volunteer work
Recipient demonstrates commitment to the future of the HIM profession through active participation in local, state, and national AHIMA activities

8c7f8bed-2550-483c-8a3b-f30218b1a870.description: Earners of this badge have completed a newly developed unit lesson plan to support engagement of online learners in one competency of health information management curricula. The lesson plan includes 5 key lesson activities to engage the online learner. Earners of this badge will be able to effectively create unit lesson plans for use in online course development.
8c7f8bed-2550-483c-8a3b-f30218b1a870.name: HIM Faculty 3.0

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a ten-week asynchronous course

fc179b95-766f-436c-84b6-b9533d2a8b33.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Advocacy and Public Policy Award, previously named the "Champion Advocacy and Public Policy Award" and the "Champion Award," honors long-term and enthusiastic support of advocacy and public policy efforts to advance the HIM profession and achieve its mission through active engagement at local, state and/or national levels. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
fc179b95-766f-436c-84b6-b9533d2a8b33.name: Triumph Award: Advocacy and Public Policy

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient advanced advocacy and public policy initiatives that promoted the interests of the HIM profession which may include legislative and regulatory efforts on behalf of AHIMA and/or the component state associations

Recipient positioned the HIM profession as a leadership force in the healthcare industry and in the development and advancement of public policy as it relates to HIM, HIT and HIE through active engagement at local, state and/or national levels
Recipient supported key AHIMA advocacy and public policy initiatives at the local, state, and/or national level

Recipient participated with AHIMA’s advocacy and public policy initiatives such as the Advocacy and Leadership Symposium/Hill Day and took those experiences and championed them with other members and stakeholders

1b5e7ec5-7f32-4329-9c5f-662ecb4c010c.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Distinguished Member Award is AHIMA’s highest honor. This award celebrates an outstanding individual in the field with a long, exceptional history of significant contributions through dedicated volunteer service, innovative professional practice, education, research, presentation or publishing. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
1b5e7ec5-7f32-4329-9c5f-662ecb4c010c.name: Triumph Award: Distinguished Member

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient supported AHIMA’s mission, vision, strategy and key initiatives, and positioned the HI/HIM profession as a leadership force in the healthcare and wellness industry
Recipient may have advanced professional practice through development of new theory; active dissemination of knowledge about cutting edge practice innovations; or leadership in a specialty area
Recipient may have conducted significant original or applied research; or authored, edited, or served on editorial boards for publications that advance the HI/HIM profession
Recipient may have educated others as a presenter, respected instructor, or by testifying at governmental hearings
Recipient may have volunteered as an officer, director, or chair for HI/HIM-related organizations; and provided inspiration, guidance, and opportunities for emerging leaders

5debedb9-5189-417f-9853-1e07296395bb.description: Earners of this badge have a solid understanding of healthcare data analytics principles and practices and have demonstrated their skills for training others on the topic.Those earning this designation will have access to AHIMA created data analytics training and have the ability to train as an AHIMA-Approved Data Analytics Trainer.
5debedb9-5189-417f-9853-1e07296395bb.name: AHIMA-Approved Data Analytics Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Data Analytics Trainer Workshop
Complete Data Analytics Trainer assessment scoring 70% or higher
Complete teaching demonstration on an assigned data analytics topic conducted during the workshop in front of peers
Active member of AHIMA
Certified Healthcare Data Analyst (CHDA)

1c3ec0e9-397d-4758-8a9d-6ec07714b888.description: Healthcare professionals who earn the title of "AHIMA International Privacy & Security Specialist" have experience maintaining and ensuring the privacy and/or security of protected health information. They are knowledgeable of HIPAA, GDPR, and region-specific privacy and security rules/regulations/standards.
1c3ec0e9-397d-4758-8a9d-6ec07714b888.name: AHIMA International Privacy & Security Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Attend AHIMA International Privacy and Security training and pass assessment
Successfully pass the AHIMA International Privacy & Security Specialist exam

94395baa-392d-4533-aea8-ef247f5c951d.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Champion Award honors long-term and enthusiastic support of advocacy and public policy efforts to advance the HIM profession and achieve its mission through active engagement at local, state and/or national levels. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
94395baa-392d-4533-aea8-ef247f5c951d.name: Triumph Award: Champion

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient advanced advocacy and public policy initiatives that promoted the interests of the HIM profession which may include legislative and regulatory efforts on behalf of AHIMA and/or the component state associations

Recipient positioned the HIM profession as a leadership force in the healthcare industry and in the development and advancement of public policy as it relates to HIM, HIT and HIE through active engagement at local, state and/or national levels
Recipient supported key AHIMA advocacy and public policy initiatives at the local, state, and/or national level

Recipient participated with AHIMA’s advocacy and public policy initiatives such as the Advocacy and Leadership Symposium/Hill Day and took those experiences and championed them with other members and stakeholders

501df47c-b2af-410a-b127-3d35dd2cefb3.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Literary Legacy Award, previously named the "Legacy Award" and the "Edna K. Huffman Literary Award," honors individuals or groups who have made a significant contribution to the HIM field through publications that have undergone formal peer review and were published. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
501df47c-b2af-410a-b127-3d35dd2cefb3.name: Triumph Award: Literary Legacy

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients authored and published books, chapters, articles, and/or guides that presented new theoretical concepts or provided further development of concepts previously advanced by others
Recipients provided tools to educate health information professionals or the general public and provided high visibility to the HIM profession and the healthcare community

dc534f03-72c8-4567-ab2c-ea4fbb786888.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Rising Star Award honors individuals who are up and coming in the HIM field, and have been employed for 5 years or less in the HIM profession. Recipients have excelled in their workplaces and volunteer roles. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
dc534f03-72c8-4567-ab2c-ea4fbb786888.name: Triumph Award: Rising Star

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient demonstrates excellence in team management through strategic and innovative ways, and leads others in these processes
Recipient solves problems while envisioning the "big picture" in health information management
Recipient demonstrates commitment to the HIM profession through active participation in local, state and national AHIMA activities

526975ee-3b73-47de-b0b0-3e933aaa2dc9.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Achievement award, which was retired in 2002, honored significant contribution to HIM practice. Recipients may have developed or refined practice theory, demonstrated leadership, or introduced innovation to HIM practice. Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
526975ee-3b73-47de-b0b0-3e933aaa2dc9.name: Triumph Award: Achievement

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient may have developed or expanded practice theories or techniques, or successfully implemented advanced theory

Recipient may have introduced creative practice innovations through advances in technology, the development of more effective quality assurance measures, or new methods of promoting employee motivation

Recipient may have demonstrated leadership in HIM education: through presentations, service as an instructor or advisory committee member for academic or in-service training programs, or through development of innovative educational strategies

fe0a4ff7-24c8-487d-ae8d-a71cc002b811.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Electronic Health Information Management (eHIM) Award, retired in 2002, was previously called the “Computer-Based Patient Record (CPR) Breakthrough Award.” The e-HIM Award honors HIM professionals who were leaders and innovators in managing computer-based patient records, a precursor to the field of Electronic Health Records. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
fe0a4ff7-24c8-487d-ae8d-a71cc002b811.name: Triumph Award: Electronic Health Information Management

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient may have authored or co-authored an article documenting their innovations that appeared in a national publication with an editorial review board
Recipient may have participated in setting facility-wide standards for electronic health records, or may have implemented systems that affected the delivery of healthcare within an organization
Recipient may have performed analysis to develop or design electronic health record systems

736d2e4c-6ba2-42a0-b7db-851f1ae7a465.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Innovation Award, previously called the "Pioneer" and "Visionary" awards, honors individuals, groups or organizations that move HIM into the future and have promoted important advances in areas where visionary thinking has made a difference: HIM practice, quality, standards, and others. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
736d2e4c-6ba2-42a0-b7db-851f1ae7a465.name: Triumph Award: Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients are forward-thinking leaders in the profession
Recipients have implemented systems that impact the quality and safety of the delivery of healthcare within an organization, across multiple organizations, or states
Recipients have participated in standards development to move HIM implementation to a new level, or demonstrated activities that have allowed others to make advances in HIM practice

Recipients have introduced creative practice innovations through advances in technology, development of more effective quality management measures, or new methods of promoting employee productivity and job satisfaction

e9f88493-5119-4267-876e-cb6873053be0.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Pioneer Award (renamed to the Innovation Award in 2014) honors individuals who are focused on moving HIM into the future of the healthcare industry. It honors persons who have promoted important advances in areas related to HIM in supporting the vision of e-HIM™, standards development, patient safety, systems development, and any domain where visionary thinking has made a difference.
e9f88493-5119-4267-876e-cb6873053be0.name: Triumph Award: Pioneer

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have a focus on moving HIM into the future of the healthcare industry.

Recipients have promoted important advances in areas related to HIM in supporting the vision of e-HIM™, standards development, patient safety, systems development, and any domain where visionary thinking has made a difference
Recipients are forward-thinking leaders in the profession

5ab04cd9-73c1-4d93-8851-49ee6b0bc6a7.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Research Award honors individuals who have made an outstanding contribution to original and applied HIM research. Recipients exemplify vision and leadership in understanding HIM philosophy and conduct, and support research demonstrating the application of these concepts. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
5ab04cd9-73c1-4d93-8851-49ee6b0bc6a7.name: Triumph Award: Research

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient shows evidence of a sustained body of research that has advanced theory and significantly impacted health information, health informatics, or related bodies of knowledge
Recipient may have obtained external peer-reviewed funding for research, and may have performed as the Principal Investigator or co-Principal Investigator
Recipient may have been published in a journal or may have had manuscript(s) accepted for publication

ed8ae804-eb9e-419d-bf5e-c7dc0b763eb2.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Emerging Leader Award honors those individuals who have made great strides and contributions to the HIM field. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
ed8ae804-eb9e-419d-bf5e-c7dc0b763eb2.name: Triumph Award: Emerging Leader

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have made great strides and contributions to the HIM field

de062879-b951-4420-9a6e-59532ad28cbc.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Motivator Award, retired in 2002, honors the excellence, commitment and expertise of those in clinical supervision positions for AHIMA Independent Study programs or at a formal HIM or HIT program. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
de062879-b951-4420-9a6e-59532ad28cbc.name: Triumph Award: Motivator

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient provided clinical sites and supervision so multiple students could achieve competencies, and supported the training process for new professionals through teaching and advising individual students
Recipient served as a mentor to guide students to new opportunities and foster their enthusiasm for the profession

a485cbe6-2796-47a8-951c-c9b0310e597b.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Community Outreach award honors those HIM professionals or groups who have embraced the need for public outreach and encouraged the overall management of health information. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
a485cbe6-2796-47a8-951c-c9b0310e597b.name: Triumph Award: Community Outreach

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient educated the public on the roles of HIM professionals and on HIM topics of interest to the public, including developing health campaigns, presenting to community groups, and using social media
Recipient was innovative and motivating to other HIM professionals to develop and deliver consumer outreach programs to promote community health awareness
Recipient encouraged professionals in other fields to partner with HIM professionals to present information about consumer health and other HIM topics

761c06d9-3e1c-4fd6-acd3-d5e6d7995551.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The CPR Breakthrough Award, which was retired in 2002, honors health Information management professionals who “pushed the envelope” in managing computer-based patient records (CPR). These individuals advanced the state of the art through their work by authoring or co-authoring an article, or creating a presentation documenting their innovations. Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
761c06d9-3e1c-4fd6-acd3-d5e6d7995551.name: Triumph Award: CPR Breakthrough

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient has "pushed the envelope” in managing computer-based patient records (CPR)
Recipient has advanced the state of the art through their work by authoring or co-authoring an article, or creating a presentation documenting their innovations

d2f22ab0-d11d-4130-a78e-22f11db7b77c.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Discovery Award, which was retired in 2002, honored unsung heroes: special people whose behind-the-scenes work was critical to the success of special projects or initiatives that benefited AHIMA members or the HIM field. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
d2f22ab0-d11d-4130-a78e-22f11db7b77c.name: Triumph Award: Discovery

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient made an important idea, special project, landmark new practice technique or insightful publication come to fruition

3471f64e-faa6-4c30-88d4-ef1d828e8293.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Visionary Award, (renamed to the Champion Award in 2004), honors those members whose groundbreaking work leads the HIM field.  These visionary professionals shape our future by asking penetrating questions, experimenting with breakthrough approaches to time-honored practices, and reaching for the next level of insight. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
3471f64e-faa6-4c30-88d4-ef1d828e8293.name: Triumph Award: Visionary

badge_template_activities.title: Recipient positioned the HIM profession as a leadership force in the healthcare industry
Recipients have ask penetrating questions, experiment with breakthrough approaches to time-honored practices, and reach for the next level of insight.

5955dabd-7fd7-4fd0-9f56-adad7db93870.description: Mentors who earn this badge completed a faculty mentoring course which corresponded with their individual mentees. Course content is related to engaging online learners. The mentor provided adequate and timely feedback via group discussions, personalized feedback via assignment assessment and supported synthesis of mentee knowledge.
5955dabd-7fd7-4fd0-9f56-adad7db93870.name: HIM Faculty Mentor 3.0

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a minimum of three years' HIM teaching experience with a CAHIM accredited program
Obtain the AHIMA RHIT or RHIA credential

7b873504-4b16-4bd7-8991-5c513cb041df.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The New Frontier Award, retired in 2001 (currently the Rising Star Award) encourages those gifted students who embody hope for the field as we look forward. Attributes include the capacity to envision the “big picture”, willingness to challenge tradition, take risks and lead others in these processes. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
7b873504-4b16-4bd7-8991-5c513cb041df.name: Triumph Award: New Frontier

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have the capacity to envision the “big picture”
Recipients have the willingness to challenge tradition, take risks and lead others in these processes

df149edd-04c0-4fde-b304-299002763d30.description: AHIMA Triumph Award recipients are honored for advancing the field of health information management. The Volunteer Award (renamed to Champion Award in 2004) recognizes volunteers who served AHIMA at the national level, in a state association, or in a specialty group.  Members must have demonstrated distinctive leadership qualities, and led their group to a significant accomplishment that advanced the field or addressed the needs of AHIMA members. AHIMA Triumph Awards are sponsored by 3M.
df149edd-04c0-4fde-b304-299002763d30.name: Triumph Award: Volunteer

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients have served AHIMA at the national level, in a state association, or in a specialty group
Recipients have demonstrated distinctive leadership qualities
Recipients have led their group to a significant accomplishment that advanced the field or addressed the needs of AHIMA members
